title: The Texture of Power: An Introduction
subtitle: Power is not for the faint of heart. In the shadows of history, rulers have risen and fallen by the blade of cunning, not the hand of virtue. Machiavelli’s The Prince is not a guide for the good, but for the victorious—a manifesto for those who would rather be feared than loved. This series will peel back the velvet curtain, revealing the cold calculations and ruthless strategies that define true power in today’s world. Welcome to the first lesson in the art of domination.
